## Properties

| Property       | Attribute      | Description                                                                                                                                                 | Type                                                                                  | Default     |
| -------------- | -------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ----------- |
| `autocomplete` | `autocomplete` | A string indicating the type of autocomplete functionality, if any, to allow on the input                                                                   | `string`                                                                              | `undefined` |
| `autofocus`    | `autofocus`    | A Boolean which, if present, makes the input take focus when the form is presented                                                                          | `boolean`                                                                             | `undefined` |
| `compact`      | `compact`      | Applies the compact size.                                                                                                                                   | `boolean`                                                                             | `undefined` |
| `disabled`     | `disabled`     | A Boolean attribute which is present if the input should be disabled                                                                                        | `boolean`                                                                             | `undefined` |
| `form`         | `form`         | The id of the `<form>` of which the input is a member; if absent, the input is a member of the nearest containing form, or is not a member of a form at all | `string`                                                                              | `undefined` |
| `inputmode`    | `inputmode`    | Indicates type of mobile keyboard that appears                                                                                                              | `"decimal" \| "email" \| "none" \| "numeric" \| "search" \| "tel" \| "text" \| "url"` | `"text"`    |
| `invalid`      | `invalid`      | Applies invalid style.                                                                                                                                      | `boolean`                                                                             | `undefined` |
| `list`         | `list`         | The id of a `<datalist>` element that provides a list of suggested values for the input                                                                     | `string`                                                                              | `undefined` |
| `maxlength`    | `maxlength`    | The maximum number of characters the input should accept                                                                                                    | `number \| string`                                                                    | `125`       |
| `minlength`    | `minlength`    | The minimum number of characters long the input can be and still be considered valid                                                                        | `number \| string`                                                                    | `undefined` |
| `name`         | `name`         | The input's name, to identify the input in the data submitted with the form's data                                                                          | `string`                                                                              | `undefined` |
| `pattern`      | `pattern`      | A regular expression the input's contents must match in order to be valid                                                                                   | `string`                                                                              | `undefined` |
| `placeholder`  | `placeholder`  | An exemplar value to display in the input field whenever it is empty                                                                                        | `string`                                                                              | `undefined` |
| `readonly`     | `readonly`     | A Boolean attribute indicating whether or not the contents of the input should be read-only                                                                 | `boolean \| string`                                                                   | `undefined` |
| `required`     | `required`     | A Boolean which, if true, indicates that the input must have a value before the form can be submitted                                                       | `boolean`                                                                             | `undefined` |
| `type`         | `type`         | A string indicating which input type the `<input>` element represents                                                                                       | `string`                                                                              | `undefined` |
| `value`        | `value`        | The input's current value                                                                                                                                   | `number \| string \| string[]`                                                        | `undefined` |


## Events

| Event   | Description                                                                                                 | Type                            |
| ------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------- |
| `ready` | Emits when the component has been loaded. Event's `detail` contains a reference to the inner input element. | `CustomEvent<HTMLInputElement>` |


## Methods

### `getNativeElement() => Promise<HTMLInputElement>`

Returns the native `<input>` element used under the hood.

#### Returns

Type: `Promise<HTMLInputElement>`




----------------------------------------------

*Built with [StencilJS](https://stenciljs.com/)*



```Message { "props" : { "className" : "mb-16" } }
**Note:** For kds-stencil-react consumers, use camel case `KdsInput` instead of dashed case `kds-input`.
```

## Basic Usage

Wrap with a [`<kds-label>`](#/components/stencil/label) component for accessibility.

```jsx
<kds-label>
  A kds-input component
  <kds-input name="example" />
</kds-label>
```

## Compact

The `compact` prop lessens an inputâ€™s height by decreasing vertical space around the text.

```jsx
<kds-label class="mb-16">
  Standard
  <kds-input />
</kds-label>
<kds-label>
  Compact
  <kds-input compact />
</kds-label>
```

## Placeholders

[AVOID using placeholders on inputs](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2018/06/placeholder-attribute/) especially for showing validation patterns.

Here is an acceptable placeholder, because we are not matching a pattern (e.g. phone number or date); we are just giving an example of a correct answer.

```jsx
<kds-label>
  Favorite Animal
  <kds-input placeholder="e.g. Horse" />
</kds-label>
```

## Invalid State

Providing an aria-label on the inner `<input>` indicates the input has an error. (It does not provide error messaging.)

```jsx
<kds-label>
  An invalid input
  <kds-input inner-aria-invalid="true" />
</kds-label>
```

## Disabled State

The `disabled` attribute blocks user interaction, suppresses events for the `<input>`, and changes the appearance of the input and its label to look inactive.

```jsx
<kds-label>
  A disabled input
  <kds-input disabled />
</kds-label>
```
